description: New Latin fricativus, from Latin fricāre, present active infinitive of fricō (“I rub”).

adjectives.description: fricative (comparative more fricative, superlative most fricative)

entries.meaning: (phonetics) produced by air flowing through a restriction in the oral cavity.
(phonetics) Any of several sounds produced by air flowing through a constriction in the oral cavity and typically producing a sibilant, hissing, or buzzing quality; a fricative consonant.
examples: Coordinate terms: approximant, lateral, nasal, trill, plosive
